paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a BRCA2 variant associated with a patient diagnosed with combined hepatocellular-cholangiocarcinoma.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A genomic analysis revealed the presence of genome-wide LOH (gLOH), contributing to the 'BRCAness' phenotype and indicating a potential benefit from PARP inhibitor.

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2 mutation is associated with sensitivity to PARP inhibitors.

variants.segregation_data: Not applicable as only one patient is reported.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation was not found in the patient's peripheral blood mononuclear cell sample, indicating it is not a germline mutation.
key_quotes: Loss of heterozygosity of BRCA2 E33* mutations can result in the biallelic inactivation of BRCA2, which would indicate sensitivity to poly ADP-ribose polymerase (PARP) inhibitors.

tables_processed.table_caption: Clinically Relevant Single Nucleotide Variants Detected in Patient’s Liver Tumor Biopsy

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the BRCA2 variant.
